In the context of the COVID-19 pandemic, school closures have highlighted various challenges related to access to education and socio-economic factors. These closures can have significant social and economic consequences, especially for working parents who may need to miss work to care for their children, leading to wage loss and reduced productivity. Additionally, localized school closures can strain schools as children are redirected, and parents may struggle with providing childcare and managing distance learning. Notably, school closures can also impact children who rely on schools for meals, with nutrition being compromised when schools are shut down. In response to these issues, there is a need for schools to remain open during the crisis to provide meals to vulnerable children who rely on free or reduced-rate meals.
